info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 1:57AM CDT until April 20 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
FFWSJT
The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Callahan County in west central Texas... Southeastern Taylor County in west central Texas...
* Until 400 AM CDT.
* At 157 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen tonight. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Abilene, Clyde, Baird, Cross Plains, Tuscola, Buffalo Gap, Lawn, Putnam, Eula, Rowden, Dudley, Oplin, Potosi, Atwell, Bradshaw, Admiral, Us-283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line, I-20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line and Ovalo.
This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 294 and 323.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... I-20 Frontage Roads west of Clyde, I-20 Frontage Roads near Baird, I-20 Frontage Roads near Putnam, crossings along County Road 249, crossings along County Road 248, crossings along County Road 129, County Road 279 crossing Kaiser Creek, crossings along Fire Road 161, crossings along County Road 134 and crossings along County Road 205.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
